paper.title: Extensions of Concept Languages for a Mechanical Engineering Application
paper.venue: GWAI '92 Proceedings of the 16th German Conference on Artificial Intelligence: Advances in Artificial Intelligence
paper.abstract: We shall consider an application in mechanical engineering, and shall show that the adequate modelling of the terminology of this problem domain in a conventional concept language poses two main representation problems. The first requires access to concrete domains, such as real numbers, while the second asks for a construct which can be used to represent sequences of varying length. As shown in recent papers by the authors there exist extended concept languages—equipped with sound and complete reasoning algorithms—that satisfy the respective representation demands separately.
